examples: That brief explanation will never satisfy .

subdefinitions.definition: To meet the needs of, to fulfill the wishes or requirements of ( someone ) .
examples: The final rehearsal of the day seemed to satisfy the director.

subdefinitions.definition: To provide what is wanted or required for ( something ) .
examples: Even three giant helpings of turkey and ham didn't satisfy her appetite.

definitions.definition: To pay to the extent of what is claimed or due.
To answer or discharge (a claim, debt, legal demand, etc.); to give compensation for.
examples: to satisfy a claim or an execution

definitions.definition: To cause (a sentence) to be true when the sentence is interpreted in one's universe.
examples: The complex numbers satisfy ∃ x : x 2 + 1 = 0 {\displaystyle \exists x:x^{2}+1=0} .

definitions.definition: To convince by ascertaining ; to free from doubt.

secondary_definitions: ( finance , transitive ) To pay to the extent of what is claimed or due.
( law , transitive ) To answer or discharge (a claim, debt, legal demand, etc.); to give compensation for.
( mathematics , logic , transitive ) To cause (a sentence) to be true when the sentence is interpreted in one's universe.
( dated , literary , transitive ) To convince by ascertaining ; to free from doubt.
